intro: Crataegus ambigua var. hohenackeri, commonly known as the Hohenacker hawthorn, is a rare and endemic species native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree characterized by its thorny branches and clusters of white or pink flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant produces small, red berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. Its leaves are typically oval with serrated edges and turn vibrant shades of red or orange in the fall. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable species for botanical study and conservation efforts.
